overview:
Martin has had various technology and technology management positions from the various first day of the Internet with BBN in Cambridge, MA, Laserdisk Computer Systems, Cadmus Computers, RPI, NYSERNet, followed by eight years (1989-1996) with PSINet which he co founded, ending there as COO/CTO and Board Member. Since then he has served as board members on two additional public companies, Go2Net, and Ascend Communications.

Martin manages private equity focusing on technology of the Internet with his partner at Alt Option Return. Martin is an 18-year veteran of multiple Internet startups and co-owner of a number of Internet standards including the Internet network management standard, SNMP, he is also the author of various IEEE and ACM peer review peer reviewed articles in networking as well as a former co-principle investigator with the NSF and DARPA.

His current professional appointments include:

School of Science Advisory Board Member of Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute

Board Member of Harrisburg Polytechnic Development Corp.

Board Member of Salvage Direct

Technical Advisory Board Member of Storage Networks Inc.

Technical Advisory Board Member of Quova

Technical Advisory Board of Mazu Networks

Martinï¿½s former professional appointments include:

Co-founder of PSINet

Former Board Member of PSINet as well as SVP & CTO (1989-1996)

Former Board Member of Ascend Communications

Founding Director of Go2Net

Co-founder and former Chairman of the Commercial Internet Exchange (CIX)

Committee chair of various IETF group
